intro: Warburgina, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Bignoniaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Warburgina thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be used in landscaping to add vibrant color to gardens.
